task.title: Accessing Google Earth in Your Browser
task.shortdesc: Google Earth can be accessed from your browser allowing you to search for and explore various places. This is available to anyone for free.

taskbody.context: The steps below will introduce you to navigating around Google Earth.

step.cmd: In the Search field, enter your address.
step.stepresult: You will see an aerial view of your neighborhood which you can zoom in or out with the control in the lower-right corner.

step.cmd: In the Search field, enter the name of a location such as, "Rocky Mountains." You can also enter longitude and latitude.
step.stepresult:
In addtion to seeing the 3-D view, an information card will appear sharing data about the site, including a Wikipedia link for more information. Not all sites have an information card. Google Earth view of the Rocky Mountains
Google Earth view of the Rocky Mountains

step.cmd: Click, the Street View icon in the lower right.
step.stepresult:
Blue highlights will appear on the map along with a pop-up stating: Select a location highlighted in blue to enter Street View. Special Locations in Google Earth
Blue dots superimposed on Google Earth indicating where to enter street view

step.cmd: Select a location highlighted in blue to enter Street View.
Click and drag your mouse to explore!
In the lower left corner click the Layers button. Here you can toggle on and off various options such as animated clouds, 3D coverage, gridlines, and photos.

image.alt: A dialog box displaying layer options in Google Earth

info.note: Layer options will vary depending on view and location.
